content.description: The best problem on the wall, in my opinion. Start as low as you like below the south arete, and climb edges to a cruxy reach for a good crimp. This has a mellow topout.
content.location: The south (right) side of the Real Pocket Wall.

climbs.name: The Real Pocket Wall V0
climbs.fa: When I was just a baby.

content.description:
This is the route that first caught my eye on this rock.  So choice.  Not that hard, high, or dramatic but oh-so aesthetic.

The start holds are bomber horizontals so you might as well kick it up a notch - pull the feet up off the ground is your first mission.  Bump up to the next horizontal to allow for a comfortable heel hook.  Go left out the small roof to the next set of horizontals and keep moving your feet up.

The crux comes above the small roof on the superb north slab.  A long reach to a small crimp, adjust, and go for the bucket further still.  Mind the tree branches on the top out.
content.location: Left of the tree on the Real Pocket Wall.  Obvious chalked mailslots mark the start.

content.description: Start on the two large holds at the bottom of the boulder. Work up and slightly right (try not to touch the tree to your right). Get a big pocket with your right hand and some high foot holds, and make a big move to a crimp ledge in the dihedral. Move straight up from there.
content.location:
It is on the West side of the Real Pocket Wall Boulder between the

V0

and

V3

. Start to the left of the tree.
